fields.value: Number of publications published in top journals

dsDescriptionValue.value: These indicators monitor scientific outcomes in the form of publications along innovation areas. The insights contained in them may help the understanding of societal challenges, contribute to the emergence of future technological or social innovations, or help to improve enabling conditions. We present the number of scientific peer-reviewed publications in the Web of Science database. Publications represent research activity in specific countries, which in turn makes entrepreneurial activities and investment more likely. Similar publication and investment patterns hint at the presence of learning networks between firms and universities. As we only track English-language publications in Web of Science indexed journals, some increases in publications may be due to the increased pressure to publish in such journals rather than to an actual increase in the productivity of a country’s researchers in the respective field. Countries that put a higher emphasis on publications in their native language may underperform according to these metrics. English-speaking countries or those where English is more dominant are likely to perform better with this metric. Be aware that due to delayed data entries in the original database the values for the last couple of years might be underestimated and could possibly increase over the next years. Have this in mind when working with data from recent years.

files.description:
For the research strand “Environmental Governance” it has been decided to look at the number of publications contained in the related top 20 journals for each research topic. Therefore, instead of querying the WoS database for keywords contained in title, abstract and author keywords, the proxy was the journal in which articles are published, i.e. “SO” field in the WoS advanced search. The outcome is a time series of number of related publications for each ERA country (34 countries). 
Google Scholar was the source for identifying the top 20 journals in the field of “Environmental Governance”.
SO=(“ENERGY POLICY” OR “ENERGY ECONOMICS” OR “CURRENT OPINION* IN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY” OR “JOURNAL OF ENVIRONMENTAL ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT” OR “MARINE POLICY” OR “ENERGY JOURNAL” OR “ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ASSESSMENT REVIEW” OR “MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION STRATEGIES FOR GLOBAL CHANGE” OR “GLOBAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLITICS” OR “RESOURCE AND ENERGY ECONOMICS” OR “CLIMATE POLICY” OR “JOURNAL OF ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT” OR “ENERGY EFFICIENCY” OR “IMPACT ASSESSMENT AND PROJECT APPRAISAL” OR “CLIMATE AND DEVELOPMENT” OR “ANNUAL REVIEW OF ENVIRONMENT AND RESOURCES” OR “WILEY INTERDISCIPLINARY REVIEWS: ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT” OR “ECONOMICS OF ENERGY & ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY” OR “ENERGY STRATEGY REVIEWS” OR “CLIMATE CHANGE ECONOMICS”) AND AD=(COUNTRYNAME)
files.label: EnvironmentalGovernance_Publications.tab

files.description:
For the two research strands Soil Sciences it has been decided to look at the number of publications contained in the related top 20 journals for this research topic. Therefore, instead of querying the WoS database for keywords contained in title, abstract and author keywords, the proxy was the journal in which articles are published, i.e. “SO” field in the WoS advanced search. The outcome is a time series of number of related publications for each ERA country (34 countries). 
SO=(“SOIL BIOLOGY BIOCHEMISTRY” OR “PLANT AND SOIL” OR “GEODERMA” OR “JOURNAL OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY” OR “SOIL TILLAGE RESEARCH” OR “APPLIED SOIL ECOLOGY” OR “SOIL SCIENCE SOCIETY OF AMERICA JOURNAL” OR “BIOLOGY AND FERTILITY OF SOILS” OR “CATENA” OR “EUROPEAN JOURNAL OF SOIL SCIENCE” OR “AGRONOMY JOURNAL” OR “JOURNAL OF SOILS AND SEDIMENTS” OR “VADOSE ZONE JOURNAL” OR “EUROPEAN JOURNAL OF SOIL BIOLOGY” OR “NUTRIENT CYCLING IN AGROECOSYSTEMS” OR “IRRIGATION SCIENCE” OR “JOURNAL OF PLANT NUTRITION AND SOIL SCIENCE” OR “PEDOSPHERE” OR “SOIL USE AND MANAGEMENT” OR “ARCHIVES OF AGRONOMY AND SOIL SCIENCE”) AND AD=(COUNTRYNAME)
Google Scholar was used for identifying the top 20 journals in the field of Soil Sciences.
files.label: SoilSciences_Publications.tab

files.description:
For the research strand Water and WasteWater it has been decided to look at the number of publications contained in the related top 20 journals for the research topics “Water Supply and Treatment” and “Hydrology and Water Resources”. Therefore, instead of querying the WoS database for keywords contained in title, abstract and author keywords, the proxy was the journal in which articles are published, i.e. “SO” field in the WoS advanced search. The outcome is a time series of number of related publications for each ERA country (34 countries). Google Scholar was used as a source for identifying the most relevant journals in the field of “Water and Wastewater” (all journals containing “water” in title) and in the field of “Hydrology and Water Resources” (all journals except ones with flood related titles).
SO=(“WATER RESEARCH” OR “WATER RESOURCE* MANAGEMENT” OR “WATER SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY” OR “JOURNAL OF WATER RESOURCES PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT” OR “DESALINATION AND WATER TREATMENT” OR “WATER” OR “JOURNAL OF WATER AND HEALTH” OR “INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF WATER RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT” OR “URBAN WATER JOURNAL” OR “JOURNAL OF HYDROLOGY” OR “WATER RESOURCES RESEARCH” OR “HYDROLOGY AND EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCES” OR “HYDROLOGICAL PROCESSES” OR “ADVANCES IN WATER RESOURCES” OR “JOURNAL OF HYDROMETEOROLOGY” OR “GROUNDWATER” OR “HYDROGEOLOGY JOURNAL” OR “JOURNAL OF WATER RESOURCES PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT” OR “JOURNAL OF HYDROLOGIC ENGINEERING” OR “VADOSE ZONE JOURNAL” OR “ECOHYDROLOGY” OR “JOURNAL OF IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE ENGINEERING” OR “JOURNAL OF HYDROINFORMATICS” OR “HYDROLOGY RESEARCH” OR “CLEAN – SOIL, AIR, WATER” OR “APPLIED WATER SCIENCE”  OR “WATER POLICY” OR “JOURNAL OF HYDRO-ENVIRONMENT RESEARCH”) AND AD=(COUNTRYNAME)
files.label: Water&Wastewater_Publications.tab
